intro: Cleyera ochnacea, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a deciduous shrub native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Cleyera ochnacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
